name: MIGIZI
description: MIGIZI offers tutoring on Tuesdays from 4-6 pm for 8th-12th graders, pairing students with tutors in Math, Science, Language Arts, and Social Studies. They are also seeking qualified tutors
services: American-Indian-owned Virtual tutoring in Minnesota consultation

name: American Indian Education Program (Osseo Area Schools)
address: While specific to Osseo Area Schools, their online presence suggests a broad reach within Minnesota
description: This program offers culturally-based educational programming for American Indian students, including academic advocacy and tutoring for middle school and high school students. They also offer Dakota and Ojibwe language tables
services: American-Indian-owned Virtual tutoring in Minnesota consultation

name: Bdote Learning Center
address: 322 Appleby Hall, 128 Pleasant Street SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455 (This appears to be a University of Minnesota address related to their programs, not a direct Bdote Learning Center physical address for tutoring services)
description: A charter school with a mission to develop culturally aware, successful students through an academically rigorous, place-based education rooted in Native language and culture. They offer language immersion and focus on land-based learning. While not strictly a virtual tutoring business, their educational approach is relevant
services: American-Indian-owned Virtual tutoring in Minnesota consultation

name: Ojibwe & Dakota Language Tutoring (University of Minnesota)
address: 322 Appleby Hall, 128 Pleasant Street SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455
description: This program offers tutoring in Ojibwe and Dakota languages. It is part of the University of Minnesota's Circle of Indigenous Nations (COIN)
services: American-Indian-owned Virtual tutoring in Minnesota consultation

name: Anoka-Hennepin School District American Indian Education Tutoring Scholarships
address: Anoka-Hennepin School District Indian Education - Tutoring, 2727 N. Ferry Street, Anoka, MN 55303
description: This program offers tutoring scholarships in partnership with Sylvan Learning Center for students in grades 1-12 to focus on math and reading skill gaps
